summary: A letter from HQ, US Army, Pacific, to the US Army Personnel Security Group regarding PFC Manuel Marti's retention in the Army, concurring with the opinion that his retention is consistent with national security interests.
summary_one_paragraph: This document is a letter dated July 2, 1969, from C. L. Shortt, CPT, AGC, HQ, US Army, Pacific, to the Chief, US Army Personnel Security Group. It concerns PFC Manuel Marti and conveys the headquarters' concurrence with the US Army Vietnam's assessment that Marti's continued service in the Army is aligned with the interests of national security, based on a review of an investigative file summarized in the basic letter. The letter references AR 604-10 and includes a copy furnished to CGUSARV (AVHGB-C).
